resources.string: Practice mindfulness through meditation to reduce stress and anxiety during challenging times. Set aside a few minutes each day to focus on your breathing, relax your mind, and cultivate a sense of calm amidst the storm.
Stay connected with loved ones during difficult times. Reach out to family and friends for emotional support and create a sense of community to share your feelings, thoughts, and concerns.

Engage in relaxation techniques like deep breathing exercises, progressive muscle relaxation, or listening to calming music. These activities help your body and mind to recover from stress and tension.
Maintain a consistent sleep schedule, even during stressful situations. Quality sleep is essential for mental and physical well-being, helping you stay focused and resilient during emergencies.
Limit exposure to stressful news and social media updates. Take breaks from constant information overload to prevent feeling overwhelmed and maintain a positive outlook.
Secure all windows and doors with barricades or storm shutters to prevent wind damage.
Turn off gas valves and avoid using open flames inside the house during the storm.
Keep flashlights, batteries, water, non-perishable food, and first-aid supplies accessible.
Stock up on necessary medications, pet supplies, and hygiene products for at least 72 hours.
Have a list of emergency contacts and local shelter information readily available.
